Quickstride scratches behind his left ear.  

"Okay so, he is a little diff=
erent in his approach to the situation, still, he means well."

Tucson had =
hoped by slightly laying down his law, it would inspire others to try to wo=
rk as one.  He did not want any fighting in the Ark among any Maximal, Pred=
acon or Autobot for that matter.  But bringing them all together under one =
banner would be most difficult especially to a new Prime who was just start=
ing out.  He uses his sonar systems to follow Ramulus, Cheetor and Lord Eld=
er, transforms into truck mode, and rolls at a reasonable speed up to Lord =
Elder, and rolls slowly beside him.  

" Your words are very wise Lord Elde=
r.  Bringing everyone together will not be easy, and I admit, I don't know =
everything either.  But I do know that I sense great strength among our gro=
up, a strength I've never quite sensed before.  A strength to overcome diff=
erences and to be able to work together under one roof.  We just need to le=
arn how to tap into that strength and we haven't quite gotten that far, at =
least, I haven't."

He stops and opens his door to Lord Elder.

"Get in, wh=
eels work faster than feet." 

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Preston Carro=
ll <supercyclonus@...> wrote:
>
> > " Must we always assume the worst Cheet=
or? Must we always follow a similar path even if it may lead us over a clif=
f to our demise? Talon is right, Perceptor risked his own life so that we m=
ay still remain functionable. If he were to turn his back on us, he would h=
ave done that vorns ago. Now, I will not hear another negative word about P=
erceptor. Not in my pressence. He has risked his life for us, and now we mu=
st do him the respect of showing him our thanks for his efforts. Now, enoug=
h bickering, we have a tunnel to seal off and Rodimus Prime to bring back o=
nline. I'm sure he wouldn't want to see any of you bickering either. Am I u=
nderstood Cheetor?"
> 
> Cheetor looked at Tuscon, his optics cool yet dim,=
 then he finally
> nodded, "You are in charge." he said, sounding sullen an=
d crestfallen.
> "If you say it, then it must be true." He turned and began=
 walking
> back toward the Ark, his shoulders slumped, his head bowed a lit=
tle.
> 
> Ramulus had glanced back at Cheetor and then Tuscon, and then jus=
t
> shook his head again as he continued to walk away. He had been helping
=
> Rhinox, perhaps it was time for him to return to that mission. Too
> much=
 time around the Ark never made him feel good. he prefered the
> wide open =
out doors, not to be confined to and one spot.
> 
> > "Wow, ya know Lord El=
der, he may not be able ta see, but he sure knows his words of wisdom. Defi=
nitely what Optimus Prime would've done."
> 
> Lord Elder watched Cheetor w=
alk back to the Ark as well, as he
> listened to Quickstride. Elder folded =
his arms behind his back as he
> turned to look back at Quickstride, "Is it=
?" Elder asked.
> 
> "Trust cannot be demanded or commanded only earned." H=
e said quietly.
> "Cheetor was not with you to watch the events that you sa=
w that caused
> you to come to trust Perceptor, how can he be expected to t=
rust
> without it?" Elder's voice was not accusatory but calm and reasoning=
.
> "Cheetor only knows what he sees here and now, and that is a Predacon
>=
 that he has fought against for a long time. It will take time to get
> ove=
r that, to see him as a companion, perhaps one day as a friend."
> 
> Elder=
 turned to look back at Perceptor, "And it will take Perceptor
> time to co=
me to realize his new role here, and that the life that he
> has known has =
ended, he has a new part to play."
> 
> Elder looked at Cheetor and Ramulus=
 for a moment, watching each one
> walk away in different directions. "It i=
s Tuscon's job now to bring us
> together, unite us under a common banner. =
That is the hardest part of
> being a leader, not just leading but inspirin=
g others to follow."
> 
> Elder turned to follow after Cheetor, his steps q=
uick to catch up with
> the swift Maximal, he would need a pep talk.
